title: Polar Graphs - identify graph from equation

content.question: Which of the following is the graph of the polar function <math alttext="r equals f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math alttext="f open parentheses theta close parentheses equals 1 plus 2 sin theta"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, in the <math alttext="x y"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-plane?

choices.label:
​

All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

The curve begins approximately at point (negative 3 pi over 2 comma 3) in quadrant 2.

The curve trends down to the right to the point (negative pi comma 1) and then reaches a minimum point (negative pi over 2 comma negative 1).

The curve then trends up to the right to the point (0 comma 1) and then reaches a maximum point (pi over 2 comma 3).

The curve then trends down to points (pi comma 1) and (3 pi over 2 comma negative 1), slightly increases and exits at the top right of quadrant 4.

​

Moving clockwise from left, the circle passes through the points with following coordinates:

(negative 3 comma 0)

(0 comma 3)

(3 comma 0)

(0 comma negative 3)

​

All coordinates are approximate.

The curve consists of an inner and outer loop that meet at the origin and are symmetric over the y axis.

One half of the outer loop begins at the origin, moves up and left into the second quadrant then moves down and left, crossing into the third quadrant, continues down and left, then moves down and right to (0 comma negative 3).

The other half of the outer loop begins at the origin, moves up and right into the first quadrant then moves down and right, crossing into the fourth quadrant, continues down and right, then moves down and left to  (0 comma negative 3).

One half of the inner loop begins at the origin, moves down and left into the third quadrant then moves down and right to  (0 comma negative 1).

The other half of the inner loop begins at the origin, moves down and right into the fourth quadrant then moves down and left to  (0 comma negative 1).

All coordinates are approximate.

The curve consists of an inner and outer loop that meet at the origin and are symmetric over the y axis.

One half of the outer loop begins at the origin, moves down and left into the third quadrant then moves up and left, crossing into the second quadrant, continues up and left, then moves up and right to (0 comma 3).

The other half of the outer loop begins at the origin, moves right and down into the fourth quadrant then moves up and right, crossing into the first quadrant, continues up and right, then moves up and left to (0 comma 3).

One half of the inner loop begins at the origin, moves up and left into the second quadrant then moves up and right to (0 comma 1).

The other half of the inner loop begins at the origin, moves up and right into the first quadrant then moves up and left to (0 comma 1).

​
